wmisc 0.2.23.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Create a nicely formatted table

    nice_table.Rd

    This function takes a data frame and formats it into a nicely formatted HTML table using the gt packages.

    nice_table(
  x,
  title = NULL,
  footnote = NULL,
  spanner = header,
  row_group = NULL,
  row_group_order = NULL,
  header = NULL,
  pack = NULL,
  rownames = FALSE,
  file = NULL,
  cols_label = NULL,
  use_labels = TRUE,
  decimals = NULL,
  round = NULL,
  label_na = NULL,
  engine = getOption("wmisc.nice.table.engine"),
  extra = NULL,
  gt = NULL,
  kable = NULL
)

    Arguments

    x

    The data frame to be formatted into a table

    title

    Title string.

    footnote

    Add footnote

    row_group

    List with information on grouping rows row_group = list("Start" = 1:2, "That is the second" = 3:5)

    row_group_order

    List with information on grouping order.

    file

    (works only when engine = "gt") If set, an additional file with the table is produced.

    cols_label

    List with renaming information for columns (old_name = new_name).

    decimals

    Number of decimals that will be printed.

    round

    Number of digits to which numbers should be rounded.

    extra

    Additional arguments passed to kableExtra::kable_classic_2()

    gt

    Additional arguments passed to gt::gt()

    kable

    Additional arguments passed to knitr::kable()

    Value

    A nicely formatted HTML table

    Examples

    df <- data.frame(
  x = 1:5, y = rnorm(5, mean = 10, sd = 12),
  c = letters[5:1], d = sample(letters, 5)
)
nice_table(
  df,
  title = "A nice title",
  footnote = c("Footnote 1", "Footnote 2"),
  spanner = list("One" = 1:2, "Two" = 3:4),
  row_group = list("Start" = 1:2, "That is the second" = 3:5),
  cols_label = list(x = "First", y = "Second", c = "Third", d = "Fourth"),
  decimals = 1
)

#>   <thead>
#>     <tr class="gt_heading">
#>       <td colspan="4" class="gt_heading gt_title gt_font_normal gt_bottom_border" style><strong>Table</strong><br>  <em>A nice title</em></td>
#>     </tr>
#>     
#>     <tr class="gt_col_headings gt_spanner_row">
#>       <th class="gt_center gt_columns_top_border gt_column_spanner_outer" rowspan="1" colspan="2" scope="colgroup" id="One">
#>         <span class="gt_column_spanner">One</span>
#>       </th>
#>       <th class="gt_center gt_columns_top_border gt_column_spanner_outer" rowspan="1" colspan="2" scope="colgroup" id="Two">
#>         <span class="gt_column_spanner">Two</span>
#>       </th>
#>     </tr>
#>     <tr class="gt_col_headings">
#>       <th class="gt_col_heading gt_columns_bottom_border gt_left" rowspan="1" colspan="1" scope="col" id="First">First</th>
#>       <th class="gt_col_heading gt_columns_bottom_border gt_center" rowspan="1" colspan="1" scope="col" id="Second">Second</th>
#>       <th class="gt_col_heading gt_columns_bottom_border gt_center" rowspan="1" colspan="1" scope="col" id="Third">Third</th>
#>       <th class="gt_col_heading gt_columns_bottom_border gt_center" rowspan="1" colspan="1" scope="col" id="Fourth">Fourth</th>
#>     </tr>
#>   </thead>
#>   <tbody class="gt_table_body">
#>     <tr class="gt_group_heading_row">
#>       <th colspan="4" class="gt_group_heading" style="text-align: center;" scope="colgroup" id="Start">Start</th>
#>     </tr>
#>     <tr class="gt_row_group_first"><td headers="Start  x" class="gt_row gt_left">1.0</td>
#> <td headers="Start  y" class="gt_row gt_center">7.6</td>
#> <td headers="Start  c" class="gt_row gt_center">e</td>

#>     </tr>
#>     <tr class="gt_row_group_first"><td headers="That is the second  x" class="gt_row gt_left">3.0</td>

#> <td headers="That is the second  c" class="gt_row gt_center">c</td>
#> <td headers="That is the second  d" class="gt_row gt_center">z</td></tr>

#>     <tr>
